intro: Alaternus lanceolatus, commonly known as the lanceleaf alaternus, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Alaternus lanceolatus is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native range.
